ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Best approach to 7M seeds

The numbers shown below for queued, queues, and downloaded are too 
little for you to be running out of memory.  I'm guessing the issue is 
explicitly related to millions of seeds -- and we need to look into this 
-- or its because you're on a 64-bit JVM/OS.

Related, you'll probably be interested in a new deciderule that was 
added last night by our Gordon: SeedAcceptDecideRule.

St.Ack

Matt Ittigson wrote:

> On 9/13/05, Matt Ittigson <cydatamatt@...> wrote:
> > On 9/6/05, stack <stack@...> wrote:
> > > Matt Ittigson wrote:
> > >
> > > > On 9/2/05, Matt Ittigson <cydatamatt@...> wrote:
> > > > > On 9/2/05, stack <stack@...> wrote:
> > > > > >
> > > > > > (You'll also likely need the aforementioned alternate queue 
> assignment
> > > > > > policy).
> > > > > > Good luck,
> > > > >
> > > > > 1,146,463 URLs loaded via the importUris JMX command with the heap
> > > > > climbing to 1,869,072 KB.  I just started the job and I'll 
> keep y'all
> > > > > apprised of the memory situation as it runs.
> > > >
> > > > Before running out of memory, the final statiscal count was 151889
> > > > downloads out of 4473197 potential (the bar graph on the summary
> > > > page).
> > >
> > > That is a small number of downloads.  I'm guessing whats killing 
> you is
> > > the number of queues.  Whats the frontier report say about queues?
> >
> > Sorry.  I needed to do other work on the machine in the meantime and I
> > ran some other jobs, so I don't believe I have access to the frontier
> > queue anymore (am I wrong?).
>
> I have a run now sitting paused for being out of memory ready for all
> sorts of poking and probing.  To answer your original question about
> the frontier report:
>
> Frontier report - 200509141458
> Job being crawled: seed-focus-cid2
>

>
> Next steps?

>
> -matt
